metadata.sermon_title: Seeing Sin as God Sees It—Psalm 51
metadata.notes: Ash Wednesday 1997 sermon focusing on confession, self-knowledge, and the nature of sin.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher avoids the 'shaming' CP. While sin is addressed, it is framed as a theological reality rather than a tool for moralistic browbeating.
quotes: Sermons that whip up a sense of sin in order to introduce the idea of God’s mercy are caricatures of the gospel.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The NP is present through the invitation to safety and the removal of the 'lifelong charade of pretense.' It promotes autonomy by encouraging the listener to drop defenses.
quotes: We do not need to live out an exhausting, lifelong charade of pretense... we are not going to be left like naked people in a storm.

adult.analysis: The sermon is highly Adult-oriented. It uses contemporary news, literature (Janet Malcolm), and opera to process the concept of confession objectively. It treats the listener as a thinking subject capable of 'searching self-inventory.'
quotes: Sin, at bottom, is not an ethical concept at all. It is a theological concept.
The recognition of sin is the result, not the means, of coming to know God.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher explicitly rejects the use of fear to drive compliance. He invites a 'free' confession rather than one coerced by the threat of judgment.
quotes: The person who confesses sin in this free way... is the person who knows that God is truly able to overcome sin.

free_child_FC.analysis: The FC appears in the appreciation of art (Mozart) and the promise of 'joy and gladness,' though the solemnity of Ash Wednesday keeps it somewhat restrained.
quotes: make me hear of joy and gladness

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher initiates an Adult-to-Adult transaction by providing data (theology, psychology, history) and inviting the listener to a reality-based self-assessment.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: No significant ulterior motives detected. The 'social' message of confession matches the 'psychological' message of relief.
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The only minor risk is the 'Parental' invitation to kneel, but this is framed as a communal liturgical act rather than a personal power play.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: The preacher actively deconstructs common religious games. He explicitly rejects the 'Bait & Switch' (whipping up sin to sell mercy) and avoids 'NIGYSOB' by placing himself in the same 'community of sinners' as the congregation.

preacher_roles.rescuer: Low. He points to Christ as the one who takes the 'storm,' rather than positioning himself as the solver of the listener's problems.
preacher_roles.persecutor: None. He explicitly avoids blaming the listener's parents or the devil, but also avoids blaming the listener in a persecutory way.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: The congregation is invited to step out of the 'Victim' role (making excuses) into 'Adult' responsibility.
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon offers a clear escape through 'Autonomy'—the ability to be seen as one truly is without the need for defenses.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: This sermon is an exemplary model of psychologically healthy homiletics. It operates primarily from the Adult ego state, inviting the listener into a reality-testing exercise regarding their own life. By rejecting the 'Bait & Switch' game and the Drama Triangle, the preacher fosters an environment of safety and authenticity. The focus on 'self-knowledge' and the removal of 'pretense' aligns with the TA goal of Autonomy (freedom from script and games).
strengths: High use of Adult data-processing to explain theological concepts.
Strong invitation to authenticity and the dropping of psychological masks.
areas_for_improvement: The transition to the 'storm of the wrath of God' at the end briefly touches on a more Critical Parent tone, though it is mitigated by the substitutionary context.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Continue to use the 'we' pronoun to maintain the Adult-Adult communal standing. The use of secular literature and art is an excellent way to keep the Adult ego state engaged.
